p: Per hospital policy the following was obtained: nasopharyngeal swab for RNA RT-PCR for COVID-19, creatine kinase (CPK), C reactive protein (CRP), lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), ferritin and a chest radiograph. CRP and CPK were mildly elevated at 27.2 mg/L and 286 units/L, respectively. The LDH and ferritin were within normal limits at 221 units/L and 112.5 ng/mL, respectively. The chest radiograph demonstrated a small patchy opacity in the right middle lobe and another in the retrocardiac region concerning for pneumonia ( figure 1). The following day, the patient’s RNA RT-PCR returned positive for COVID-19.
